Justification: To check for anemia or infection, which can cause fatigue.
To rule out hypothyroidism, a common cause of fatigue.
To assess electrolyte imbalances, kidney function, and glucose levels.
To evaluate liver health, as liver dysfunction can lead to fatigue.
To check for deficiencies that can cause fatigue and lethargy.
To assess for iron deficiency anemia, a common cause of fatigue.
To evaluate for depression, given the stress and poor sleep reported.
To assess for sleep disorders such as sleep apnea, given the poor sleep quality.

Investigations: C-reactive protein (CRP) or Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
Justification: To check for inflammation or chronic disease.
